image.altText: A man looks to the ground as leaves a Canberra court.

props.synopsis: A 38-year-old man has been spared jail time, partly on account of his autism diagnosis, after raping a woman he met online and filming their sexual encounters without consent.

title.children: Man spared jail time by ACT court after raping woman he met online

image.altText: a person using a mobile phone

props.synopsis: The High Court has ruled on the use of information gathered through the AN0M app, which was developed by the Australian Federal Police for surveillance.

title.children: High Court endorses use of encrypted phone app to monitor crime figures

image.altText: Two pedestrians walking northbound across a three-lane road bridge with a pedestrian path over a lake.

props.synopsis: Loneliness is rising fastest among Canberrans in their 30s and 40s, with new research showing this cohort is now more likely than younger people to report feeling lonely.

title.children: Canberrans in their 30s and 40s now the city's loneliest, survey finds

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The 17-year-old was arrested when police found a large number of videos and messages on his phone and laptop depicting violent extremist acts, many of which were highly disturbing.

title.children: Teen found with violent extremist material driven by 'teenage bravado'

image.altText: Russian fighter

props.synopsis: The Australian man is accused of breaching Russia's criminal code by participating as a mercenary in an armed conflict.

title.children: Australian sentenced to jail by Russian court for fighting in Ukraine

image.altText: Two uniformed police officers stand in tall yellow grass next to a badly damaged motorcycle caught in a chicken wire fence.

props.synopsis: A 57-year-old Canberra man dies after losing control and colliding with a tree on Tidbinbilla Road. His death is the ACT's fifth road fatality this year.

title.children: Police allegedly saw group of motorcyclists speeding before fatal crash

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly "stormed a home" and threatened a mother and son with a taser while demanding prescription drugs and cash will remain in custody.

title.children: Man allegedly 'stormed home' armed with taser and threatened mother and son

image.altText: A teenage boy holding a softball bat and glove, looking sad.

props.synopsis: It was a schoolyard sport so common it once rivalled cricket as the most popular in Australia. But now grassroots teams are struggling to fill a team sheet.

title.children: Australia were world champs, now teams are scrambling for players

image.altText: SUV with bullet holes

props.synopsis: Police say tactical officers foiled an alleged planned hit near a day care centre in Revesby in Sydney's south-west on Tuesday afternoon.

title.children: 'Collateral damage' avoided as NSW Police foil alleged hit near day care

image.altText: The Victoria Police insignia on the sleeve of an officer's shirt.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a digital forensics officer and are investigating whether his work compromised hundreds of cases over nearly a decade including sexual offence and child abuse cases.

title.children: Police alerting accused offenders and lawyers as hundreds of cases re-examined

image.altText: Andreas Slavkos at his graduation.

props.synopsis: Students have been left with HECS debts and careers that are "non-existent" after completing degrees that were not accredited. Class actions have been launched against two Australian universities.

title.children: Careers in limbo after graduates discover university courses were never accredited

image.altText: A long line of people hiking on a snow-covered mountain.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of trekkers, villagers and support staff have safely reached the Tibetan town of Qudang, according to Chinese state media.

title.children: More than 500 hikers reportedly rescued from Mount Everest

image.altText: A yellow Australian rules ball sitting on the grass.

props.synopsis: A Perth football club faces deregistration and has been expelled from their club rooms after a player reportedly attended a post-season party dressed as Stephen Hawking, allegedly with explicit images attached.

title.children: Explicit 'Silly Sunday' Stephen Hawking stunt sees football club facing expulsion

image.altText: A woman in a dark hijab smiles as she holds a toddler in her arms on a beach.

props.synopsis: Children in Gaza are experiencing grief, loss, displacement, and starvation. For some, this is all they know or remember.

title.children: 'He doesn't feel like a normal child': War's toll on Gaza's babies

image.altText: Mark Latham wearing a suit speaking to media on the street outside court.

props.synopsis: Independent MP Mark Latham has spoken out against former partner Nathalie Matthews during an ongoing legal battle, on the same day she pleaded not guilty to intimate image charges in a separate matter.

title.children: Mark Latham's outburst against ex-partner outside court

image.altText: Gold bullion stacking up.

props.synopsis: The price of gold has hit another record and is set to become Australia's second most valuable resource export after iron ore.

title.children: Gold prices surge as investors watch 'extraordinary global scenario'

image.altText: A man smiles while speaking in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: An appeal against a $2.85 million compensation payout to a man who suffered child sexual abuse while in state care should be abandoned, a prominent Perth lawyer and the state opposition says.

title.children: Abuse survivor 'mortified' by state's challenge of $2.85m compensation payout

image.altText: A blue Southwest plane parked on tarmac, with a air traffic  tower behind it.

props.synopsis: The US government shutdown is entering its second week and the impacts are starting to play out, with thousands of flights disrupted across the country.

title.children: Why the government shutdown is causing chaos at US airports

image.altText: Aerial view of humpback whales in tight formation.

props.synopsis: A drone photographer captures vision of a tightly packed pod of 11 humpback whales heading south in a race to mate off the NSW mid-north coast.

title.children: Humpback whales 'in mating pursuit' spotted in large, speedy pod

image.altText: Daniel Noboa standing next to a damaged black SUV, wearing dark sunglasses and a leather jacket, surrounded by security guards.

props.synopsis: Five people have been detained after hundreds of protesters surrounded the presidential motorcade of Daniel Noboa and began throwing rocks and stones.

title.children: Ecuadorians filmed throwing rocks in 'presidential assassination attempt'

image.altText: A sign that says "for lease".

props.synopsis: Median rental prices have risen to more than $700 per week for the first time, according to Cotality's Quarterly Rental Review.

title.children: Increasing rent driving people away from employment

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large green numbers, showing the price of shares which have risen.

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar surges against the Japanese yen on speculation its central bank will delay lifting interest rates, while the ASX 200 begins its day with a slight fall and the gold price surges above $US4,000 an ounce. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie dollar jumps to 10-month high against Japanese yen

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Gas price campaign called out as a 'distraction'
Why is gold hitting record highs?

image.altText: John Noh speaks into a microphone at a wood desk.

props.synopsis: The AUKUS submarine pact may need "commonsense" action from both Australia and the US to make it more "sustainable", according to Donald Trump's nominee to oversee US defence strategy in the Indo-Pacific.

title.children: Trump's Pentagon nominee flags possible 'commonsense' AUKUS changes

image.altText: a professional woman smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The former clinical director of the Hobart Clinic, psychiatrist Dr Hannah Lake, is part of a last-minute push for the institution to be given a reprieve before it closes its doors at the end of next week.

title.children: Leading doctor's 11th-hour bid for $2m rescue of Hobart Clinic

image.altText: Clayton Oliver stands with his hands on his head after a 2025 AFL match.

props.synopsis: Gold Coast secures a first-round pick from St Kilda in exchange for Sam Flanders, which could open the doors to a deal being done with Melbourne for Christian Petracca. Follow live.

title.children: Collingwood drops Oliver hint as trade race with GWS heats up

image.altText: Dolly Parton wearing a pink and black top with her arm leaning on a chair

props.synopsis: Dolly Parton's sister has asked fans to pray for the country music singer's health just one week after the star delayed several concerts in Las Vegas.

title.children: Dolly Parton's sister speaks out over singer's health concerns

image.altText: An illustration of Google search on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: One year on from the rollout of Google AI Overviews in Australia, exclusive data shows steep year-on-year declines in readership for the top news websites as smaller publishers warn of lay-offs.

title.children: Fears of online journalism Armageddon as Google changes the game

image.altText: A blonde woman casts a sideways look at Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: US Attorney-General Pam Bondi has faced heated questioning from senators over claims she's transforming the justice department into a "shield for the president and his political allies".

title.children: US attorney-general accused of using justice system to protect Trump

image.altText: Chelsea FC Women star Sam Kerr stands on the pitch smiling widely after a win.

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr's two year absence from the Matildas is almost over, she's set to feature in friendlies later this month, while Mary Fowler is recovering well from her own ACL injury.

title.children: Kerr finally set for Matildas return, Fowler on track for Asian Cup

image.altText: An orange round circle with the shadow of a tree on them and a black background

props.synopsis: Stargazers from around the world have captured the luminous glow of October's supermoon.

title.children: Stunning photos as supermoon season begins

image.altText: A headshot of Taylor Swift with jewels and feathers surrounding her head

props.synopsis: Founder and designer Paul Vasileff says he's grateful to have his Adelaide-made couture dress on the world stage with pop superstar Taylor Swift wearing it in the new The Fate of Ophelia music video.

title.children: Taylor Swift shines in Australian-designed dress in lead single

image.altText: Minjee Lee looks to one side

props.synopsis: Australian superstar Minjee Lee is in line for several big awards as the 2025 golf season enters the home stretch in Asia.

title.children: Minjee Lee chases more prizes in Asian golf swing

image.altText: Young people sit at a wooden table conversing with each other under dance floor lights.

props.synopsis: When the dating app radius won't reach the edge of your property, and you're harvesting grain from sun-up til sundown, how do you find a partner?

title.children: Speed dating a solution to the slow dating lives of farmers
